body_html:
@girving
What do you mean in (1) when you say "always take grad_1 and process it appropriately"? What grad_1?

P.S. I have noticed that there is _ReluGradGrad in nn_grad.py which is derivative of the relu's gradient. Maybe there is a way to do something similar with softmax xentropy?

P.S.S. Have I understood correctly that I can find all ops' signatures in gen_nn_ops.py::_InitOpDefLibrary.op_list_ascii?

@girving
What do you mean in (1) when you say "always take grad_1 and process it appropriately"? What grad_1?
P.S. I have noticed that there is _ReluGradGrad in nn_grad.py which is derivative of the relu's gradient. Maybe there is a way to do something similar with softmax xentropy?
P.S.S. Have I understood correctly that I can find all ops' signatures in gen_nn_ops.py::_InitOpDefLibrary.op_list_ascii?
body:
@girving 
What do you mean in (1) when you say "always take grad_1 and process it appropriately"? What grad_1?


P.S. I have noticed that there is `_ReluGradGrad` in `nn_grad.py` which is derivative of the relu's gradient. Maybe there is a way to do something similar with softmax xentropy?

P.S.S. Have I understood correctly that I can find all ops' signatures in `gen_nn_ops.py::_InitOpDefLibrary.op_list_ascii`?
